meanings.definition: The process of wearing away or changing the appearance or texture of something over time due to exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent1: The weathering of the old statue made it look worn and rough.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the weathering of the rocks by the river smoothed their surface.
meanings.sent3: The weathering of the wooden fence gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile showed signs of weathering from years of laughter and joy.
meanings.sent5: The weathering of the ancient ruins told stories of the past civilizations.

meanings.definition: The act of withstanding or enduring difficult conditions or situations.
meanings.sent1: The weathering of the storm by the sturdy house impressed the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: His weathering of the challenging exam showed his determination to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The weathering of the long wait at the doctor's office tested her patience.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship proved strong through the weathering of many disagreements.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's weathering of the harsh training prepared him for battle.
